intro: Hieraciodes longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers are arranged in a single head, with ray florets that resemble petals. Hieraciodes longipes is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
